gtceu.machine.cracker.tooltip.1: - §7For every 1 level above §6Cupronickel§7, recipe energy consumption is reduced by 10%%
gtceu.machine.electric_blast_furnace.too: §2- §lBlast Furnace Coil Bonus: §7§oFor every voltage tier above §bMV§7§o, temperature is increased by §r100K.
§7§o   For every §f900K§7§o above the recipe temperature, energy consumption is reduced by §f5%%.§r
§7§o   For every §f1800K§7§o above the recipe temperature, one perfect overclock is granted.§r
gtceu.machine.parallel_hatch_mk5.tooltip: Allows to run up to 64 recipes in parallel.
gtceu.machine.parallel_hatch_mk6.tooltip: Allows to run up to 256 recipes in parallel.
gtceu.machine.parallel_hatch_mk7.tooltip: Allows to run up to 1024 recipes in parallel.
gtceu.machine.parallel_hatch_mk8.tooltip: Allows to run up to 4096 recipes in parallel.
item.gtceu.crystal_processor_assembly.to: §7As If You Can Hear the Crystals Grow
item.gtceu.quantum_processor_computer.to: §7Error Rate Less Than One in a Billion
item.sftcore.order.tooltip.0: Right click to put a virtual item
item.sftcore.order.tooltip.1: Can be used as the product for AE2 automatic crafting
item.sftcore.order.tooltip.2: When the crafting is completed, it will automatically cancel, no need to cancel manually
item.sftcore.time_bottle.accelerate: Using %s EU, accelerate the machine with %d ticks
item.sftcore.time_bottle.energy_lack: Your wireless energy DOES NOT support the machine acceleration.
item.sftcore.time_bottle.tooltip: Right click on a machine and finish the current recipe instantly with the wireless energy.
sftcore.item.super_upgrade.tooltip: Can be used infinitely. Press shift and right click the machine to install the update
sftcore.item.super_upgrade_card.tooltip: Can be used infinitely. Press shift and right click the ae block to install the update
Create an ingredient with a fixed item
sftcore.item.wildcard_pattern.io.tag_pre: Create an ingredient with the GT tag
sftcore.machine.certus_quartz_charger.to: Release the power of Certus Quartz.
sftcore.machine.common_factory.tooltip.0: - §7The simple machine in the§r machine adjustment hatch§7 limits the recipe type and voltage.§r
sftcore.machine.common_factory.tooltip.1: - §7The voltage of energy hatch and machine must match, though it is allowed to use two energy hatch.§r
sftcore.machine.common_factory.tooltip.2: - §7For every 1 level above §6Cupronickel§7, the machine gets 4 extra parallels§r
sftcore.machine.common_factory.voltage_i: The voltage of energy hatch and machine don't match!
sftcore.machine.greenhouse.tooltip: Hope our plants can grow well.
sftcore.machine.large_cracker.tooltip.0: - §7For every 1 level above §6Cupronickel§7, recipe energy and time consumption are both reduced by 10%
sftcore.machine.large_inscriber.tooltip: A large inscriber for advanced circuits.
sftcore.machine.oil_drilling_rig.tooltip: Oh, It's not so environmental friendly...
sftcore.machine.ore_replicator.tooltip: Place it under an ore block and it will generate ores.
sftcore.mixin.ae2.pattern_encoder.toolti: - Can automatically refill the blank pattern
- Can automatically transfer encoded pattern to assembly matrix
- Can multiply the number of items processed by patterns
sftcore.mixin.ae2.pattern_encoding.craft: The encoded pattern will not be automatically sent to the assembly matrix
The encoded pattern will be automatically sent to the assembly matrix (if possible)
sftcore.mixin.ae2.pattern_encoding.multi: Multiply the pattern by %d. This will increase the item assigning speed when CPU does not have enough accelerators, and be more performance friendly for large amount processing.
sftcore.mixin.travel_anchor.travel_staff: Do not have the cooldown time
sftcore.multiblock.allow_laser.1: §7§o   Laser hatch can provide huge energy, and must be used together with a normal energy hatch.
sftcore.multiblock.half_perfect_overcloc: §7§o   Process 3 times faster when overclocked with 4 times power§r
sftcore.multiblock.mega_reduce_with_coil: §7§o   For every §d%dK§7§o above coil temperature, recipe energy is multiplied by §a%s§r§7§o and time by §9%s§r
sftcore.multiblock.perfect_overclock.too: §7§o   Increase power casually without increasing total energy consumption§r
sftcore.ponder.ae_crafting_system.text_1: To set up an automated crafting system...
sftcore.ponder.ae_crafting_system.text_2: You need a Crafting CPU multiblock
sftcore.ponder.ae_crafting_system.text_3: as well as a Pattern Provider and an Output Destination
sftcore.ponder.ae_crafting_system.text_4: By writing patterns with the Pattern Encoding Terminal and placing them into the Pattern Provider, you can start ordering crafts
sftcore.ponder.annihilation_plane.text_1: If the network can still store items, the Annihilation Plane will collect blocks or item entities in front of it into the network
sftcore.ponder.annihilation_plane_filter: Break or Collect Special Items with Annihilation Plane
You will find that the Annihilation Plane collects all items in front of it...
To address this, you can configure your network to only accept certain items
Set up the entire production as a sub-network without placing any drives
It is important to note that blocks without drops will be destroyed by the Annihilation Plane regardless
Perhaps you can consider enchanting the Annihilation Plane with Silk Touch
sftcore.ponder.automation_metallurgic_in: The most challenging part of automating the Metallurgic Infuser is how to get the materials and infusing items into the correct slots
Set the output to Pattern Provider (blue), remember to enable auto-eject
Encoding Pattern: 8 Iron Ingots + 1 Enriched Redstone = 8 Infused Alloys
With that, the automation of the Metallurgic Infuser is complete! Note that for different recipes, you need to mark the Storage Bus filter as needed
Recalling the subnetwork distribution of Pattern Provider...
We use an Interface to receive items from the Pattern Provider, forming a subnetwork locally
Don't forget to power the subnetwork with Quartz Fiber
Two Storage Buses represent different input slots, distributing items within the subnetwork
Setting the output direction of the Pattern Provider to prevent it from distributing materials directly to the adjacent Metallurgic Infuser
Now, we need to program the Pattern Provider with the correct patterns for automation
Open the configuration interface of the Metallurgic Infuser...
sftcore.ponder.crafting_cpu.text_1: There are some rules to build a CPU...
sftcore.ponder.crafting_cpu.text_2: The shape of CPU must be a cuboid
sftcore.ponder.crafting_cpu.text_3: A CPU that is not a cuboid will not appear in a formed state
sftcore.ponder.crafting_cpu.text_4: CPU structure must contain at least one Crafting Storage, with total storage equal to the sum of all Crafting Storages
sftcore.ponder.crafting_cpu.text_5: The rest can be filled with Crafting Units, Crafting Monitors, Crafting Storages, and Crafting Accelerators
sftcore.ponder.crafting_parallel.text_1: Multiple Pattern Providers executing the same pattern can achieve parallelism across multiple machines
sftcore.ponder.crafting_parallel.text_2: Memory Cards can copy machine configurations and apply them to other machines, and Pattern Providers are no exception.
sftcore.ponder.crafting_parallel.text_3: Use the Memory Card to right-click the Pattern Provider while sneaking...
sftcore.ponder.crafting_parallel.text_4: The Pattern Provider will store the pattern information into the Memory Card
sftcore.ponder.crafting_parallel.text_5: Then, use the Memory Card to right-click the target Pattern Provider...
sftcore.ponder.crafting_parallel.text_6: The Memory Card will consume a Blank Pattern from your inventory and copy the pattern into the target Pattern Provider
sftcore.ponder.crafting_parallel.text_7: Repeat the process to build parallelism
sftcore.ponder.crafting_principle.text_2: Click the Pattern Provider with a Wrench to set its direction
sftcore.ponder.crafting_principle.text_3: When the network sends a crafting request...
sftcore.ponder.crafting_principle.text_4: The Pattern Provider outputs the ingredients to adjacent inventories
sftcore.ponder.crafting_principle.text_5: To complete a craft, the items need to be returned to the network
sftcore.ponder.crafting_principle.text_6: Thus you need to build a return system, or you can also use other Interfaces or Providers to return items to the network
sftcore.ponder.fission_reactor.text_1: Use Fission Reactor Casing to build a cuboid frame with length 3~18 blocks, width 3~18 blocks, and height 4~18 blocks
sftcore.ponder.fission_reactor.text_2: Then fill all faces of the cuboid with Reactor Glass or Fission Reactor Casing
sftcore.ponder.fission_reactor.text_3: Replace some of the casing on the faces with Fission Reactor Ports
sftcore.ponder.fission_reactor.text_4: Shift right-click the port with a Configurator to change its input/output mode
sftcore.ponder.fission_reactor.text_5: Place Fission Fuel Assemblies vertically inside the reactor
sftcore.ponder.fission_reactor.text_6: Place Control Rod Assemblies on top of the Fuel Assemblies
sftcore.ponder.fission_reactor.text_7: You can also automate the reactor using the Fission Reactor Logic Adapter
sftcore.ponder.formation_plane.text_1: Formation Planes can output items from the network as either blocks or item entities
sftcore.ponder.formation_plane.text_3: Formation Plane will place the block in front of it
sftcore.ponder.formation_plane.text_5: Formation Plane will drop the item entity in front of it
sftcore.ponder.formation_plane.text_6: Configuring the filter options of the Formation Plane allows it to only output items within the filter
sftcore.ponder.import_export_bus.header: The Import and Export of Storage
sftcore.ponder.import_export_bus.text_1: The Import and Export Buses allow direct insertion and extraction from the network
sftcore.ponder.import_export_bus.text_2: The Export Bus extracts items from the network into a target inventory
sftcore.ponder.import_export_bus.text_3: Unlike the Import Bus, the Export Bus requires a filter to specify which items to extract
sftcore.ponder.import_export_bus.text_4: The Import Bus inserts items from a target inventory into the network
sftcore.ponder.import_export_bus.text_5: The Import Bus can be configured with filters...
sftcore.ponder.interface.header: The Interface to Communicate with Outside World
sftcore.ponder.interface.text_1: The ME Interface is the interface between the network and the outside world
sftcore.ponder.interface.text_2: You can directly input items into the network from the ME Interface
sftcore.ponder.interface.text_3: Configuring the slots of the ME Interface
sftcore.ponder.interface.text_4: It will fill itself with items to the amount you set
sftcore.ponder.io_port.header: Use IO Ports to Organize Storage
sftcore.ponder.io_port.text_1: IO Ports can import items from storage cells inside them into the network, or export stored contents from the network into the cells
sftcore.ponder.io_port.text_2: You can use it to export items from the network into storage cells
sftcore.ponder.io_port.text_3: You can also use IO Ports to organize the contents of storage cells in drives
sftcore.ponder.io_port_output.header: Using IO Ports to Output Large Amounts of Items
sftcore.ponder.io_port_output.text_1: IO Ports have very fast input and output speeds...
sftcore.ponder.io_port_output.text_2: The high speed makes IO Ports ideal for mass production of items like Singularity if Infinity Cells are available
sftcore.ponder.me_controller_scene.text_: Controller needs to be powered to function
A Controller can extend up to 7 blocks in each direction
Controllers will turn red and become unusable if they exceed the 7-block limit
A network may only have one connected ME Controller, which means you cannot link two different controllers with Cables
Controllers cannot be placed in a cross shape
sftcore.ponder.molecular_assembler.text_: You need to place it together with the Pattern Provider
Molecular Assembler can automate crafting, stonecutting, and smithing table recipes, sending the products back to the Pattern Provider
Both the Pattern Provider and Molecular Assembler can transfer the network...
So you can build a structure like this
Later on, you can replace the Molecular Assembler with the more efficient Assembler Matrix
sftcore.ponder.pattern_provider_interact: ME Interface is also an inventory, when the Pattern Provider is adjacent to an ME Interface...
The Pattern Provider will directly input the ingredients into the network where the ME Interface is located
This is important for some complex machine mechanisms, you can refer to the Metallurgic Infuser's ponder information.
sftcore.ponder.quantum_network_bridge.he: Use Quantum Bridge for Remote Network Transmission
sftcore.ponder.quantum_network_bridge.te: Quantum Bridge can be used for remote network transmission, even across dimensions. A pair of Quantum Rings can transmit up to 32 channels.
To build a Quantum Ring structure, you need eight Quantum Rings and one Quantum Link
Network can only be connected to the Quantum Ring through the four Quantum Ring blocks surrounding the Quantum Link
The Quantum Rings are used in pairs, you need to place another Quantum Ring structure at the remote end where you need it
To activate the Quantum Rings, you need to insert a Quantum Entangled Singularity into each of the two Quantum Rings
Quantum Bridge transmits data at a fixed cost of 400 AE/t, regardless of distance
In the same dimension, a more economical solution is the ME Wireless Connector
sftcore.ponder.sps.text_1: Use Supercritical Phase Shifter Casing and Structure Glass to build the shape like this...
sftcore.ponder.sps.text_2: And fill all 6 sides with the same shape, edge to edge
sftcore.ponder.sps.text_3: Place the Supercritical Phase Shifter Port here and supply it with a large amount of power
sftcore.ponder.sps.text_4: And place a Supercharged Coil here
sftcore.ponder.sps.text_5: Replace several structure glass on other sides with Supercritical Phase Shifter Ports
sftcore.ponder.sps.text_6: Shift right-click to configure the port to output mode
sftcore.ponder.sps.text_7: Now use Pressurized Tubes to input Polonium into the input port to produce Antimatter!
sftcore.ponder.storage_bus.text_1: The Storage Bus allows external storage to be accessed by the AE Network
sftcore.ponder.storage_subnetwork.text_1: When you want one network to access the contents of another...
sftcore.ponder.storage_subnetwork.text_2: Connect the Storage Bus to an ME Interface
sftcore.ponder.storage_subnetwork.text_3: The network on the end of the Storage Bus (the main network)...
sftcore.ponder.storage_subnetwork.text_4: ...can access the network on the other end of the ME Interface (the subnetwork)
sftcore.ponder.storage_subnetwork.text_5: While the opposite is not true
sftcore.ponder.storage_subnetwork.text_6: By configuring the Storage Bus, you can set the main network to have read-only, write-only, or read-write access to the subnetwork, as well as apply filters for reading and writing.
sftcore.ponder.tag.ae2_automation.descri: Get rid of the pain of Manual Crafting from now on
sftcore.ponder.tag.ae2_network.descripti: Building a powerful ME Network starts from here
sftcore.ponder.tag.ae_storage.descriptio: Store massive amounts of items and fluids with ease
sftcore.ponder.tag.mek_multiblock.descri: Build and play with multiblock structures!
sftcore.ponder.turbine.text_10: Finally, cap it off with Turbine Casing and Structure Glass
sftcore.ponder.turbine.text_11: Replace Turbine Casing and Structure Glass with Turbine Valves for input and output
sftcore.ponder.turbine.text_12: Input steam, and you will get a large amount of power!
sftcore.ponder.turbine.text_2: First, build a base with Turbine Casing with an odd length, up to 17
sftcore.ponder.turbine.text_3: Place Turbine Rotors vertically in the center
sftcore.ponder.turbine.text_4: Hold a Turbine Blade and right-click the Turbine Rotor to install blades, two blades are required for each rotor
sftcore.ponder.turbine.text_5: Place a Rotation Complex on top of the rotors
sftcore.ponder.turbine.text_6: Fill the layer of the Rotation Complex with Pressure Dispersers
sftcore.ponder.turbine.text_7: Place Electromagnetic Coils directly above the Rotation Complex, connected and at least half the number of rotors
sftcore.ponder.turbine.text_8: Replace Turbine Casing around and above the Pressure Dispersers with as many Turbine Vanes as possible
sftcore.ponder.turbine.text_9: If needed, you can also place several Saturated Condensers in the upper layer to recycle water
sftcore.void_portal.tooltip: Right click and see what will happen
sftcore.wool_to_string.tooltip: Right click wool blocks to get string
